intro: Listera smithii, commonly known as Smith's basketwart, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Appalachian region of the United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. It has a short stem that supports its delicate foliage and blooms from late spring to early summer. Listera smithii is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and environmental changes.
